get.description: Lists all of the available Microsoft.Solutions REST API operations.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

200.description: OK. The request has succeeded.

schema.description: A list of REST API operations supported by an Azure Resource Provider. It contains an URL link to get the next set of results.

items.title: REST API Operation
items.description: Details of a REST API operation, returned from the Resource Provider Operations API

name.description: The name of the operation, as per Resource-Based Access Control (RBAC). Examples: "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/write", "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/capture/action"

isDataAction.description: Whether the operation applies to data-plane. This is "true" for data-plane operations and "false" for ARM/control-plane operations.

display.description: Localized display information for this particular operation.

provider.description: The localized friendly form of the resource provider name, e.g. "Microsoft Monitoring Insights" or "Microsoft Compute".

resource.description: The localized friendly name of the resource type related to this operation. E.g. "Virtual Machines" or "Job Schedule Collections".

operation.description: The concise, localized friendly name for the operation; suitable for dropdowns. E.g. "Create or Update Virtual Machine", "Restart Virtual Machine".

description.description: The short, localized friendly description of the operation; suitable for tool tips and detailed views.

origin.description: The intended executor of the operation; as in Resource Based Access Control (RBAC) and audit logs UX. Default value is "user,system"

actionType.description: Enum. Indicates the action type. "Internal" refers to actions that are for internal only APIs.

value.description: List of operations supported by the resource provider

nextLink.description: URL to get the next set of operation list results (if there are any).

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: The name of the managed application.

200.description: OK - Returns the managed application.

systemData.description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

managedBy.description: ID of the resource that manages this resource.

applicationDefinitionId.description: The fully qualified path of managed application definition Id.

parameters.description: Name and value pairs that define the managed application parameters. It can be a JObject or a well formed JSON string.

outputs.description: Name and value pairs that define the managed application outputs.

resourceUsageId.description: The managed application resource usage Id.

jitAccessPolicy.description: The managed application Jit access policy.

jitAccessEnabled.description: Whether the JIT access is enabled.

maximumJitAccessDuration.description: The maximum duration JIT access is granted. This is an ISO8601 time period value.

authorizations.description: The  read-only authorizations property that is retrieved from the application package.

principalId.description: The provider's principal identifier. This is the identity that the provider will use to call ARM to manage the managed application resources.

roleDefinitionId.description: The provider's role definition identifier. This role will define all the permissions that the provider must have on the managed application's container resource group. This role definition cannot have permission to delete the resource group.

customerSupport.description: The read-only customer support property that is retrieved from the application package.

supportUrls.description: The read-only support URLs property that is retrieved from the application package.

artifacts.description: The collection of managed application artifacts.

uri.description: The managed application artifact blob uri.

createdBy.description: The client entity that created the JIT request.

updatedBy.description: The client entity that last updated the JIT request.

kind.description: The kind of the managed application. Allowed values are MarketPlace and ServiceCatalog.

principalId.description: The principal ID of resource identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID of resource.

principalId.description: The principal id of user assigned identity.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of user assigned identity.

additionalProperties.description: Represents the user assigned identity that is contained within the UserAssignedIdentities dictionary on ResourceIdentity

userAssignedIdentities.description: The list of user identities associated with the resource. The user identity dictionary key references will be resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}'.

expiresIn.description: The number of seconds the access token will be valid.

expiresOn.description: The timespan when the access token expires. This is represented as the number of seconds from epoch.

notBefore.description: The timespan when the access token takes effect. This is represented as the number of seconds from epoch.

authorizationAudience.description: The aud (audience) the access token was request for. This is the same as what was provided in the listTokens request.

resourceId.description: The Azure resource ID for the issued token. This is either the managed application ID or the user-assigned identity ID.
